title: Question 4
prompt: Which of the following is a fact, not an opinion, based on the graph?
description:
Click the one best answer to each question.

The world is undergoing a modern trend toward urbanization. The UN predicts that by 2030, sixty per cent of the world’s population will live in urban areas. Less developed regions will have the greatest increase in urban population. The modern increase in urban growth in less developed areas has been accompanied by an increase in the number of impoverished people in these cities.
feedback: The bar for Latin America representing the year 1995 shows that the urban population will be over 70%. Therefore, the rural population will be less than 30%, the remainder of the population. Since this is a statement of an observable statistic—a fact—that is true based on the graph, this answer is correct.
